Introduction

Base URL: http://localhost 
This documentation aims to provide all the information you need to work with our API.

<aside>As you scroll, you'll see code examples for working with the API in different programming languages in the dark area to the right (or as part of the content on mobile).
You can switch the language used with the tabs at the top right (or from the nav menu at the top left on mobile).</aside>

Authenticating requests

To authenticate requests, include an Authorization header with the value "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}".

All authenticated endpoints are marked with a requires authentication badge in the documentation below.

You can retrieve your token by visiting your dashboard and clicking Generate API token.

Accounts

Display a listing of the accounts.

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://localhost/api/v1/accounts?per_page=25" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/accounts"
);

const params = {
    "per_page": "25",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200, Success):


{"data":[{"id":1,"name":"Cash Account","code":"1110",...}],"links":{...},"meta":{...}}

Example response (401, Unauthenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v1/accounts

Headers

Authorization        

Example: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}

Content-Type        

Example: application/json

Accept        

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

per_page   integer  optional    

The number of accounts to return per page. Defaults to 15. Example: 25

Store a newly created resource in storage.

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://localhost/api/v1/accounts" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"parent_id\": 1,
    \"name\": \"Cash\",
    \"code\": \"1110\",
    \"type\": \"asset\",
    \"description\": \"Cash on hand\",
    \"is_active\": true,
    \"level\": 2
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/accounts"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "parent_id": 1,
    "name": "Cash",
    "code": "1110",
    "type": "asset",
    "description": "Cash on hand",
    "is_active": true,
    "level": 2
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (201, Success):


{"data":{"id":1,"name":"Cash Account","code":"1110",...}}

Example response (401, Unauthenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (422, Validation Error):


{
    "message": "The name field is required.",
    "errors": {
        "name": [
            "The name field is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v1/accounts

Headers

Authorization        

Example: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}

Content-Type        

Example: application/json

Accept        

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

parent_id   integer  optional    

The ID of the parent account. Example: 1

name   string     

The name of the account. Example: Cash

code   string     

The account code. Must be unique. Example: 1110

type   string     

The type of the account. Example: asset

description   string  optional    

The description of the account. Example: Cash on hand

is_active   boolean     

Whether the account is active. Example: true

level   integer     

The level of the account in the hierarchy. Example: 2

Empty response

    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

    "message": "Account not found."

    "http://localhost/api/v1/currency-settings"

    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

Quick Create Product

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://localhost/api/v1/products/quick-create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "code="PROD-001""\
    --form "name="New Product""\
    --form "stock_quantity=100"\
    --form "low_stock_threshold=45"\
    --form "price=99.99"\
    --form "selling_price=149.99"\
    --form "category_id=1"\
    --form "units_id=1"\
    --form "supplier_id=1"\
    --form "warehouse_id=1"\
    --form "description=Dolores dolorum amet iste laborum eius est dolor."\
    --form "has_expiry="\
    --form "image=@C:\Users\123\AppData\Local\Temp\phpF0E3.tmp" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/products/quick-create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('code', '"PROD-001"');
body.append('name', '"New Product"');
body.append('stock_quantity', '100');
body.append('low_stock_threshold', '45');
body.append('price', '99.99');
body.append('selling_price', '149.99');
body.append('category_id', '1');
body.append('units_id', '1');
body.append('supplier_id', '1');
body.append('warehouse_id', '1');
body.append('description', 'Dolores dolorum amet iste laborum eius est dolor.');
body.append('has_expiry', '');
body.append('image', document.querySelector('input[name="image"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200, Success):

Authorization        

Example: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}

Content-Type        

Example: application/json

Accept        

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

per_page   integer  optional    

The number of products to return per page. Defaults to 15. Example: 25

Create a new product.

requires authentication

Creates a new product with the provided data.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://localhost/api/v1/products" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"Laptop Pro\",
    \"code\": \"LP-001\",
    \"price\": 1200.5,
    \"selling_price\": 1499.99,
    \"category_id\": 2,
    \"supplier_id\": 1,
    \"units_id\": 1,
    \"warehouse_id\": 1,
    \"stock_quantity\": 50,
    \"description\": \"Dolores dolorum amet iste laborum eius est dolor.\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/products"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "Laptop Pro",
    "code": "LP-001",
    "price": 1200.5,
    "selling_price": 1499.99,
    "category_id": 2,
    "supplier_id": 1,
    "units_id": 1,
    "warehouse_id": 1,
    "stock_quantity": 50,
    "description": "Dolores dolorum amet iste laborum eius est dolor."
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (201, Success):


{"data":{"id":15,"code":"LP-001","name":"Laptop Pro","price":1200.5,"selling_price":1499.99,"stock_quantity":50,...}}

Example response (401, Unauthenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (422, Validation Error):


{
    "message": "The name field is required.",
    "errors": {
        "name": [
            "The name field is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

}"

POST admin/product/quick-create

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://localhost/admin/product/quick-create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "code="PROD-001""\
    --form "name="New Product""\
    --form "stock_quantity=100"\
    --form "low_stock_threshold=45"\
    --form "price=99.99"\
    --form "selling_price=149.99"\
    --form "category_id=1"\
    --form "units_id=1"\
    --form "supplier_id=1"\
    --form "warehouse_id=17"\
    --form "description=Dolores dolorum amet iste laborum eius est dolor."\
    --form "has_expiry="\
    --form "image=@C:\Users\123\AppData\Local\Temp\phpF326.tmp" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/admin/product/quick-create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('code', '"PROD-001"');
body.append('name', '"New Product"');
body.append('stock_quantity', '100');
body.append('low_stock_threshold', '45');
body.append('price', '99.99');
body.append('selling_price', '149.99');
body.append('category_id', '1');
body.append('units_id', '1');
body.append('supplier_id', '1');
body.append('warehouse_id', '17');
body.append('description', 'Dolores dolorum amet iste laborum eius est dolor.');
body.append('has_expiry', '');
body.append('image', document.querySelector('input[name="image"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Product created successfully",
    "product": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "New Product"
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Purchase Order Items

Display a listing of the purchase order items.

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://localhost/api/v1/po-items?per_page=25" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/po-items"
);

const params = {
    "per_page": "25",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

{"data":[{"id":1,"po_id":1,"product_id":1,"quantity":10,...}],"links":{...},"meta":{...}}

Purchase Orders

Bulk Delete Purchase Orders

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://localhost/api/v1/purchases/bulk-delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"ids\": \"[1, 2, 3]\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/purchases/bulk-delete"
);

Retrieves a paginated list of purchase orders.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://localhost/api/v1/purchases?per_page=25" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/purchases"
);

const params = {
    "per_page": "25",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Get Recent Transactions

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://localhost/api/v1/reports/recent-transactions?per_page=25&type=consequatur&status=consequatur&date_range=%27this_month%27&search=consequatur&start_date=2023-01-01&end_date=2023-12-31&sort=date&direction=desc" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/reports/recent-transactions"
);

const params = {
    "per_page": "25",
    "type": "consequatur",
    "status": "consequatur",
    "date_range": "'this_month'",
    "search": "consequatur",
    "start_date": "2023-01-01",
    "end_date": "2023-12-31",
    "sort": "date",
    "direction": "desc",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200, Success):


{
    "transactions": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "type": "sale",
                "ref_id": 1,
                "date": "2025-12-01",
                "amount": 100,
                "description": "Sale #1",
                "status": "paid"
            }
        ]
    },
    "summary": {
        "total_sales": 100,
        "total_purchases": 0,
        "total_paid": 100,
        "total_due": 0
    }
}

Example response (401, Unauthenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Filter by status (e.g., 'paid', 'due'). Example: consequatur

Date range filter ('today', 'this_week', 'this_month', 'all'). Example: 'this_month'

search   string  optional    

Search term. Example: consequatur

date Start date for filtering. Example: 2023-01-01

end_date   string  optional    

date End date for filtering. Example: 2023-12-31

sort   string  optional    

Field to sort by. Example: date

direction   string  optional    

Sort direction (asc or desc). Example: desc

Bulk Mark Transactions as Paid

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://localhost/api/v1/reports/transactions/bulk-mark-paid" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"transaction_ids\": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost/api/v1/reports/transactions/bulk-mark-paid"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_API_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "transaction_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200, Success):


{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Successfully marked 3 transaction(s) as paid.",
    "updated_count": 3
}

Example response (401, Unauthenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (422, Validation Error):


{
    "message": "The transaction_ids field is required.",
    "errors": {
        "transaction_ids": [
            "The transaction_ids field is required."
        ]
    }
}
